SENT.plain: Acute embolic occlusion of the intracranial internal carotid bifurcation is associated with a poor prognosis
Recanalization rates of this lesion with intravenous or intraarterial thrombolysis are exceedingly low
We describe the use of balloon angioplasty after failed thrombolysis to achieve immediate recanalization of acute carotid T occlusions in two patients
At 1-month follow-up, both patients were alive with neurologic deficits
For acute carotid T occlusion, balloon angioplasty should be considered a first-line endovascular therapy
